ZBHOyGsVO0nCNg3Ci32WLg.text: Eddie Merlot's is a classic upscale steakhouse with a few unusual twists. The restaurant is huge and extremely attractive, having been completely remodeled after the failure of several predecessors in the space. The menu is pretty much what you'd expect from such a place, but it also includes unusual items such as sinfully high priced steaks and rarely seen classics like Steak Diane. Someone high up in the chain of command apparently has a streak of pyromania, because in addition to the Steak Diane there is at least one other entre and multiple deserts that are prepared with flames at table side. The wine list is good, not great, with prices in the expected range (i.e. high). Service was satisfactory last night, but the restaurant was empty due to the cold weather, so there wasn't much of a challenge. We ordered the Steak Diane for two and shared the special cheesy potatoes and, believe it or not, the creamed corn, which is not the same as your mother served(e.g. jalapenos are involved). Continuing the flame theme, we shared the bananas foster for desert. The wine was a decent Malbec. All of the food was excellent. Prices, as you would expect, are at the special occasion level, so our return visits will be well spaced.

_PPNvvrmSVHmbWQH7v_76A.text: I just had dinner there this evening, 9-16-2018.  It was Fantastic!! I arrived without a reservation right after a Steelers game.  The kind hostesses worked hard and found me a spot!  I am in town for a conference and am alone on this trip.  My server was Stephen and from the moment I sat down, he was awesome!  It can be intimidating to dine alone in an unfamiliar city.  He made me feel welcomed and at ease.  He offered great recommendations and ultimately I chose the bone-in ribeye, baked potato and French onion soup.  Seriously it was heaven in my mouth!! I'm a major foodie, travel often and eat out way too much, however this place ROCKS!! (And they play great 80's music overhead). I could not have been more pleased!  For health reasons I will probably never return to this great place, but heaven willing, I hope to!    To the owners, managers and staff, I say well done!

ZNISdVlj8cwmvTxwchN3Ng.text: We came here Monday night for dinner as part of a large work group dinner. Overall the location was convenient to our offices as well as the hotels at which the out of town guests stayed. The menu had a nice assortment of cocktails and wines. I started off with the berry white martini, which consisted of strawberry and raspberry vodkas, fresh sweet and sour, dekuyper triple sec and fresh berries. It was really sweet and delicious but deceivingly strong (see pic).  Our host selected a group appetizer sampler which consisted of tuna wontons, bacon wrapped barbecue shrimp and prime rib potstickers. All were really good. The shrimp were huge. I also had a French onion soup (okay). For dinner, I selected the 10 oz filet rare. When my entree came out it was actually medium and I needed to send it back. The second time around was perfect. We also ordered a bunch of sides to share--Eddie Merlot's potatoes (okay), Mac and cheese (also okay) and Brussels sprouts.  We wrapped up dinner with some desserts. I passed on dessert as I was already full from dinner but ordered the Eddie Merlot's coffee, which I mistook to be non alcoholic (misread the menu). It was fine but I really just wanted a chocolate flavored coffee.  Overall the food was good but this is not the best steakhouse I have been to.  Service was decent but towards the end of the meal a little slow. Also, in speaking with my coworkers the day after, a few of them feel a little put off by the main waiter. They felt he was a little pushy I getting some of them to order the more expensive entree (vs the ordering off of the Monday night prix fixe menu). Also he got one of my coworkers a second glass of wine when she did not order one. And finally he served out the sides family style when only certain individuals wanted sides. We were a group of 13 and some of my coworkers felt he was up selling to maximize the tab, and ultimately the gratuity.  While I did not pay, I overheard one of the servers tell our boss that they were taking off some of the items from the tab due to some of the steaks not being prepared correctly. I thought that was really nice of Eddie Merlot's to do that!!

TBv32tBuIuHo5y9QB9Bcqg.text: We were seated in a waiter's section, named Gordon. Gordon is an asset to this restaurant. +25 years experience, knowledge about the menu and a friendly gentleman.  He made our dining experience. By the end of the dinner, I wanted to shake his hand for the experience.  To the meal, we both had filets. I had the tri filet medallion, the sauces were fresh and delicious. The peppercorn was a touch much.  Amazing cuts of meat that melt in your mouth.  Try the Eddie potatoes.

IQOhi-i1l8z6JPRNggd2hQ.text: Great place for a special occasion. Our anniversary dinner was special. The Chef's Fav filet Del Mar was good portion. Steak was tender and juicy. But the complimentary anniversary creme brulee was a perfect sweet treat ending. All staff was attentive and friendly. I will strongly suggest becoming a Platinum Eddie Merlot's card member. Great rewards well worth it!

CX8-qGhjoejfdb8-8zLJ7Q.text: I had my first visit, after wanting to for a long time, and it did not disappoint.  The decor, the food, the service--all top notch.  I had a meal with family.  We had filet del mar (topped with lump crab) which came with shrimp and potatoes, plus salad (we had Chef's Favorites), and the other had crab legs, plus creamed spinach and Eddie's potatoes.  Everything was delicious, enough food, with leftovers of both sides.  The server (and up to three help with taking the order, serving and clearing the table) gave us good tips about the sides and desserts--both are big enough for two to three people.  As a plus, they validate parking for Four Gateway Center, right beside/within the restaurant!  If you're visiting Pittsburgh, or live here, and want a great dining experience, you must try Eddie Merlot's!

a1r--uVtHfyGiI0XVh9Oeg.text: Exceptional food. Exceptional service.  Being that I am a complete carnivore my lovely wife took me to Eddie Merlot's as a surprise for my birthday. I had never been before so I was very excited. As soon as she gave her name I was not only greeted with a Happy Birthday from the hostess and manager but, a few of the servers actually sang me Happy Birthday. Once they finished we were shown to our table. I was never in this space when it was Palomino's but, it is a very lovely space as Eddie Merlot's  A few seconds later our waiter came and went over the features of the evening. After we had made our selections he brought us some delicious bread to start with. For beverages we all had the lemonade. It was very good and quite refreshing coming in from the summer heat.  For my entree I chose the 16oz Prime Ribeye Steak topped with Bacon Gorgonzola Cheese paired with a Sauteed Crab Cake and Lobster Macaroni and Cheese for my side. My steak was just plain remarkable! It was very tender and juicy and cooked to perfection. The Bacon Gorgonzola Cheese was the perfect addition to the steak as it added a unique flavor to the meal. The Lobster Macaroni and Cheese was exceptional as well. Full of lobster and filled with different types of cheeses.   My wife started off with a Caesar salad which she absolutely loved. For her entree she chose the New Orleans Mixed Grill. It features a 4 oz. Filet Mignon, grilled shrimp, Andouille sausage and roasted garlic mashed potatoes. Our daughter got the Filet Mignon topped with steak butter with garlic mashed potatoes as a side. She devoured everything on her plate so I think she was pleased.  After we were finished with our meals our waiter packed the rest of our food to go and even packed us a fresh full loaf of bread to enjoy with it. he also gave us each a Eddie Merlot piece of chocolate that was delicious.   My only two complaints are one like others have said is that I wish the food was served a bit warmer as the AC was on Antarctica so after 15 to 20 minutes our food was getting cold and two it would have been nice to of been offered a birthday dessert or something which I wasn't which to me is strange. Otherwise our waiter has very good the entire evening.   Eddie Merlot's is a chain steak house just like Ruth's Chris, Morton's, Hype Park and Capital Grill but they defiantly bring something different and unique to the Pittsburgh Steakhouse Fine Dining Scene.   Insider Tip: Be sure to park in the garage in the building where Eddie Merlot's is located as they will validate your parking ticket.

royjky0HzqNb827sLMBrFg.text: Eddie Merlot's is my favorite restaurant in my 23 years in Pittsburgh, specifically because of the exceptional service from Pat. I've been eating here for years now and there is never been even a slight hiccup. He is so attentive, genuine, and educated on the restaurant. His positive energy and exuberant personality makes coming to dine downtown at Eddie Merlots something I look forward to every week. Pat is the best server I've ever experienced and I wish everywhere treated the guest the way I feel treated by him.

VJnT-5q3HlFRYjxnyI5nqQ.text: Eddie Merlot's seems to be going downhill. This visit was actually my third over the past year. My first experience in the fall of 2017 was for Happy Hour and my friends and I ordered dinner from the Happy Hour menu. Our server was friendly and efficient and our food was good. My second experience was Easter Brunch in 2018. I was looking forward to the lamb that was advertised. Although I like my lamb medium rare, the lamb served on the buffet was extremely rare and not very flavorful. The remainder of the buffet was adequate, but nothing super special. Our service was excellent.   My visit this past week is why I started this review with disappointment. The worst part of the visit was the condition of the restroom. The Ladies Room stunk of urine. Two of the stalls were out of service. The next one I looked in had no toilet paper. Finally I found a stall with toilet paper. There was towel litter strewn across the sink area. It did not appear that anyone had been in to clean the place in quite awhile. All the trash cans were overflowing. The smell was the worst, though. Our servers behind the bar (it was Happy Hour again) were quite rude. There was a lot of confusion over the bill. I wasn't drinking, so I observed what was happening to my friends with a sober eye.   I will be quite hesitant to return based on this last visit. The extremely poor condition of the women's restroom speaks volumes as to the management of the place, in my opinion. I gave three stars because of my past visits, but based on this last experience it would have been a 0.

o2H5eI2KxBPLJ_NRw7MYGQ.text: I went for Galentines day with one of my girlfriends last night. The service was amazing. I had some red wine that was VERY good. But I was a little disappointed with the quality of the food. We ordered the potstickers and they were tasty, but the ribeye was just okay. The lobster mac and cheese was okay and so were the Brussel sprouts. Maybe it was just what I anticipated for super high quality food. But I also did not order the more expensive steaks as well. Overall I had a really nice time and will be coming back to try more meats!

YhU8pZysk9uQqPuQcyu0FQ.text: I would definitely describe it as a "fancy" restaurant. Beautiful dining room with gorgeous fixtures. Ask to be seated in Gordon's area, you will be very happy that you did. Gordon is polite, friendly, attentive and kind. The menu is a la cart. So prepare to either have a large big or an empty stomach. The wine list is long but like everything else on the menu, expensive.  The sea bass was poorly prepared, just about raw with carrots that were inedible because they were over salted. The ahi tuna was perfectly prepared rare with the smallest of accompaniment of pieces of mushroom and asparagus.  Your water glass will never be empty and you will never feel ignored or forgotten, The service is excellent.

elYkgy7PtGs-pbsVHKuAVQ.text: Great customer service. My office had a Christmas party here and the food was indescribable. So simple but so full of flavor. The staff was so nice and helpful and we were all able to have a great time.

OeA7uYaSRzs9pfj7zeKuwQ.text: I took my boyfriend for his birthday during a weekend trip to Pittsburgh. It was our first time in the city so I did some research to find one of the best steakhouses & decided on this one. I had high hopes but ended up very disappointed.   The food was unimpressive. Not awful but not good either. At a good steakhouse I expect to be wowed. I expect to leave so satisfied that I don't stop talking about how good it was for at least a few hours or even days after. This was not the case here, in fact, after this meal I couldn't stop talking about how much I didn't like it. The food did not have much flavor, we needed to add salt & pepper to everything (something I usually never do).  The beef carpaccio & Brussels bored us. Our rib eyes lacked that buttery melt-in-your-mouth juiciness & flavor. If only the rib eyes were tastier I would have been happy & not cared much about the apps & sides, but as the main event, the steak should not be mediocre. We did enjoy the Mac n cheese, Caesar salad, & the warm bread & fluffy butter was delicious (maybe the best part).   The waiter was not friendly & seemed to be struggling to put a smile on his face. He seemed annoyed with my very first question about a Cabernet & responded by avoiding my question & instead offering an answer to a question I did not ask. He seemed rushed, stressed out & overwhelmed. As someone who has worked as a waistress before, I can sympathize with the feeling but I would know better than to ever let that stress show to my customers. He made us feel like we shouldn't ask too much of him or it would just worsen the situation. So we tried to go easy on him.   After we finished the meal, we were finishing our drinks & I started to feel a horrible pain in my stomach. I ran to the bathroom & had diarrhea. It was extremely upsetting that I just spent almost $300 on a meal that made me feel awful. I'm assuming it was the beef carpaccio but it's hard to be sure. In conclusion, it was a pretty terrible experience.

Iv5d_n_9wBdFb2ntsyb5jQ.text: This review is hot off the press as my belly is still full from the mouthwatering meal that I just had.  I just gained 10 pounds from dinner tonight and I am one satisfied customer.  1st time eating here and everything that I ordered was delicious.  The  complimentary loaf of bread was warm and very tasty.  The wedge salad was amazing - hands down one of the best salads I've ever had in life.  Then I ordered the bone-in filet mignon.  It was seasoned just right and the outside seared to perfection.  Thinking about it right now is making my mouth water.  Even their brussel sprouts were delicious!  For dessert I got the bananas foster and it was made right in front of me!  (See video below)  The service was top notch.  Our waiter, Armindo, kindly explained the specials and what he recommended on the menu.  Even paired our meal with a great cabernet wine.  The venue was very intimate, very classy decor.  Wonderful place for date night.  Pretty pricey but worth every penny!  I came here for a work event so after dinner, my colleague and I hung out at the bar to recap the night.  Our bartender was excellent.  Great conversationalist and gave us lots of tips regarding the Pittsburgh area.  He even gave me a free slice of carrot cake on the house!  If you know me, sweets are the way to my heart and Eddie Merlot, me and you are going steady from now on!

qaLy1ZOgmtLN1ypLqFuOjg.text: Nice atmosphere and good service.  Oysters presentation was nice ( had to ask for horseradish).  Cesar salad was average at best.  I had the 16oz bone in filet medium. It came out with very little pink.  I sent it back and was then questioned by the waitress and manager like I didn't know what a medium steak should be.  Very insulting. My next steak was extremely rare - see picture.   Fortunately, they took it off the bill.  If you desire a steak in Pittsburgh -  DON'T GO HERE

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie Merlot's - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NoYMbS8qLKaLi0b97fDO7Q.text: I really wanted to give this place 5 stars. I held off writing my review hoping nostalgia might set in and some of the edge could be taken off, but to no avail.   As my wife and I entered we were very impressed with the decor and ambiance and both mentioned the superior aesthetics. We were promptly greeted by our server, Tim I believe, who took our drink orders and said he'd be back with the specials; great energy, charismatic, we were preparing for a wonderful dining experience with Tim as our guide.   He returned a few minutes later with our drinks, their version of a mule for me and a glass of moscato d'asti for my wife. As Tim read the specials, my wife was convinced of the surf and turf, crab legs and a filet. Tim mentioned varying sizes of steaks and seafood portions in case you wanted more of one or less of the other so my wife said she wanted the smallest filet cut (more on this later) I had my heart set on the platinum cut wagyu ribeye ordered Pittsburgh rare.   While waiting for our entrees, our French onion soup and wedge salads arrived, both of which were fantastic, the soup being some of the best I've had. As we sampled our drinks, my wife mentioned her wine not tasting right, more like a Pinot and also noted it did not have the characteristic bubbles of the d'asti. When we brought this to Tim's attention, he commented that he's not sure what happened, he poured the bottle himself. He took the glass and moments later an older gentleman, guessing a manager, came out with a new bottle and all was right.   Out come the steaks, seemingly cooked to perfection. My wife's filet was tender and the crab legs were cooked well also. At first glance of my steak, I noticed it was bone in, which the menu had not mentioned (for the ribeye, but the NY was bone in). I cut into the steak and although it was cooked perfectly, something was off, did not "feel" or look like a traditional ribeye, the steak really seemed to be a NY strip. (Having grown up in a butcher shop you tend to to notice fat/bone placement and can identify cuts) I asked Tim if I received the correct steak and he assured me that I had.   The rest of the meal went well, the wife had a delicious creme brulee and I opted out of dessert. When the time came to settle the check, I noticed the bill had a charge for Pinot, the wife's filet was upgraded to their platinum cut wagyu without our knowing (it was the smallest cut filet, however one would assume a $40+ upgrade should at least be brought up) , and my steak charge read NY strip. (Tim said there wasn't a key for wagyu ribeye in their system, that they have to ring it in a NY and tell the kitchen ribeye, seems hard to believe for an upscale restaurant).   As I mentioned, I really wanted to like this place but the oversight of details, the hidden upcharge, and the incorrect cut of steak really left a bad taste in my mouth for a meal of that grandeur. If I'm going to pay that kind of money for a dinner for 2 I expect perfection, or at least a little more consideration when things aren't right.   The search for the best steak in Pittsburgh continues, such is life.

mmNIHz_WWykNiB2DAAPIJw.text: Love Love Love!!! I've probably eaten here at least 10 times and they have yet to disappoint! They're stuffed shrimp is sooo delicious. I've have my filet Oscar Style and it was absolutely delicious! My favorite side is the Lobster Mash and the service is always on point! Would definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie Merlot's - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

cfSylBZmfgX3yvgZeGj50g.text: Me and my girlfriend cane here for our one year anniversary dinner and this place is wonderful! I was a little hesitant because of the poor reviews and it being a bit pricy but let me say that's not the case. I feel like a bad server most certainly could ruin the dinner here but ours was amazing. On walking in to check in with our reservation they greeted us and wished us a happy anniversary. That was pretty cool and super thoughtful I thought. On sitting the table was super well set and right by the window so that was really nice. We don't go out to eat at super fancy places a lot so we decided to go big or go home. I'm not big into drinking but my date had some wine and it was nice that they brought over a glass to feel the wine glass and left some in there for a refill. We started with the bread appetizer and it was so good and fresh and the dusting was so good on top. Next we had the spinach and artichoke dip and omg it was the best I've ever had so fresh and flavorful. Next we had the candy bacon and holy freaking molly the flavor was unreal! The plating looked great and the sauce was wonderful. For dinner I ordered a 45 day dry aged New York strip I think it was. It was amazing and cooked perfectly and soft soft and tender. Had to get a side of the crab legs and omg to die for the melted butter and how they where split it just made it that much better. My date had the vegan pasta and she said it was so flavorful and cooked perfectly. We got sides of Mac and cheese and cheesy potatoes. The Mac and cheese sucked but the potatoes now where so good. Needless to say we crushed everything. For desert we had the carrot cake. It was so good and fresh and was the best I've ever had all the fresh fruit played so well together. One thing to mention is I was hot sauce for the potatoes and Mac and the guy looked at my funny but was able to get me some so that was great. Overall this restaurant was amazing and I'm so happy we came here. I couldn't have asked for a more perfect dinner. I can't wait till we come back and pig out again on all the delicious food.

gtNV61QD3NQTcrDR-55zTg.text: We were so excited to dine at Eddie Merlot's, yet we were very disappointed after leaving. The service was below average. We enjoyed our meals. We ordered the candied bacon, oysters Rockefeller, ribeye, salmon, and pork chops. The service started off bad when walking into the restaurant and the hostesses were inattentive when we arrived. I also called earlier to request a booth and mentioned it was my mother's birthday which they completely disregarded. They brought us the wrong cocktails as well. I wouldn't recommend the cognac brownie for dessert either. Not to mention a homeless man was let into the restaurant with the worst smell, bothering customers. Granted the food was delicious, we will not be back.

KTqiGZ4yAJ9vjUu3IzZyJw.text: My experience at Eddie Merlot's was unbelievable, from the sit down to end meal, everything blew me away. The service was next to none and the food was nearly unexplainable with proper grammar. The sweet and spicy shrimp was savory yet flash friend so perfectly, it was truly mouth watering. I got the French onion soup which was also very delicious and fresh, as my date got the king crab and corn bisque. Which was one of the best soups I've ever tried. NZhhFFTUpl8iIY1D1COWSA.text: Mediocre at best. The filet, while perfectly cooked medium rare, was super chewy and gristly. This establishment focuses more on the exclusivity of being a "prime" steakhouse than the actually steaks. Do yourself a favor and stick to the appetizers and deserts. If you're really craving a good steak, just invest in a sous vide and a cast iron skillet.

37i0xR3dGXW5tohhTwYzDQ.text: I tried Eddie Merlot's for the first time last night for a business dinner. Everything was excellent. I had a Bone in Bison Ribeye that was AMAZING!!  The service was on point, and wine options at 1/2 price Monday was a nice surprise. If you're tired of the same 3 steak houses, give them a try.

hCquO1b8v9giHE3xCdWZag.text: We were in town on business, and went here to celebrate a birthday. Had the lobster tail and it was fantastic. The portions were large and delicious. Everyone shared their food so we all got a portion. Our compliments to the chef.

3oC993ttEoupQVg1CgxWfA.text: Great new addition to the steakhouse group in Pittsburgh. Very modern interior and by far the best steak in the group. Very creative presentation on the traditional shrimp cocktail, called the smoking shrimp cocktail! Service was excellent! Walk past Ruth's and enjoy!

-gEGcUNia-a8-dH-I90v6g.text: When you are someone with food sensitivities it is hard to find a restaurant that has understanding servers and chef- and Eddie Merlot's is one of them- have been there multiple times and always feel comfortable there- was there last Thursday night and the halibut was wonderful- I am a fan!

QDpF2kHkVVUWEkQw3w0QfQ.text: We don't often go out for steak dinners but Eddie Merlots might change that. Delightful service and excellent food. The filet trio verges on obscene. In a good way. Beef stroganoff is delicate and delicious.

HJ0gq539PaT7Bg4YYrUTwA.text: Business lunch with clients on a tight schedule.   Slow service.....decent food.  2nd time we experienced slow service at lunch.    Can't comment on dinner service, will not be going back for lunch.

y7QX9WIoMMJ-Anz-vtE6vg.text: If you love a great variety of food, Eddie Merlot is the place to go. My wife and I have been several times and are never disappointed. The staff is great and the environment is classy and laid back. Not to mention the food is amazing. Highly favored!

moqYrYipZqCeHercBxtPAg.text: Let me begin by saying that I am a Black Card Member at Eddie Merlot's which means that I eat there a lot and I do enjoy it usually dining at the bar. However lately they have changed the menu and made it much more expensive and less bar friendly most certainly. The removed the cheeses and charcuterie and the smaller carpaccio and other appetizers and now it is quite pricey to even just sit and have a drink. A poor decision to me. I can afford to eat anywhere so price is not an issue but rather value. In regards to the food. I love the Beet Salad, just an incredible dish and well presented and great for sharing. I usually will have the Medallion Trio which is three filet mignons each prepared differently, one peppercorn, one gorgonzola cheese topping and one with crabmeat and bernaise sauce along with a twice baked potato. Great for sharing. Their special app is the Bacon wrapped BBQ Shrimp which honestly though tasty, I have found to be a bit chewy. I do need to comment on the service. The best around Tiffany and the two Michaels behind the bar Andy and Jeff are among my favorite servers. This place can be pricey but if you do it right and share plates (there is a lot of food in each serving) it can be reasonable.

bWEiFfE6Yqbbtjk-1W4j3g.text: Way overpriced and very limited wine list.  Design of the front bar is very economical with limited selection of spirits, service was average and food was ok, not great.  Dinner for 3 was $900 with tip and no dessert.  Place to be seen but sadly not a great dining experience.  Seafood appetizer had 6 oysters, six shrimp, and 3 split crab legs  - disappointing for the price. I will not return but you will see me back at Capital Grille.

L03jqOuFw_U_XEgOujxWDw.text: My husband and I dined here last weekend. The restaurant is very nice, service and steaks were great. We tried the filet mignon and dry aged New York strip.

ooIO0XYMMTTs-LyYXlkPOw.text: After browsing at the Art's Fest, we decided to walk over and have a drink and appetizer at Eddie Merlot's. We were so excited to sit at the bar and experience this new restaurant in Pittsburgh. We sat at the bar while three bartenders stood around conversing amongst themselves, looked over at us and then looked away! We sat there for at least another minute or so while continuing to be ignored when we finally called a bartender over to take our drink order. She never asked if we wanted menus so another bartender gave them to us after we asked. We ordered the calamari, which was tempura battered, fried and greasy. Needless to say it was not good. I ordered a moscow mule and it wasn't served in a copper mug...disappointing. The whole experience didn't end quickly enough and suffice it to say, we will not be going back. I have owned a business for 10 years and I would never think to treat my clients like we were treated. The whole atmosphere left a lot to be desired. With the many wonderful restaurants to choose from in Pittsburgh, one would think the "new kid on the block" would be trying a little harder to attract a clientele, not turn them off.

XnKOckJVzp9AWY3BVjWgSQ.text: Went for a NYE dinner and loved it! Ambiance & Decor was warm and inviting. The staff was A+, very knowledgeable & attentive. The prices were steep, (with a steak being 50+ w/o a side) but the food is worth the cost, especially the succulent beef & lobster mac n cheese! Desserts was a slight disappointment (creame brulee) but the food and the fine wait staff more than made up for it. I will come here again. Lovely place!

OqQAGzApg_vJad_SzN73OA.text: My husband and I celebrated our 53rd anniversary last evening at Eddie Merlot's and everything was wonderful.  Our servers (Cameron and David) couldn't have been any better - they were both personal, caring and very attentive.  The manager (Larry) even helped us to our parking spot!  We were a little hesitant about driving to Pittsburgh for dinner but directions were easy, validated parking was a perk, and eating at this restaurant was definitely worth it!  I can't say enough about the taste and quality of the food.  We both had the "summer grill" for $89 for two - had the 7oz filet mignon, salad and veg.  They kindly gave us a complimentary drink before dinner and an amazing dessert after dinner.  Thanks to everyone at "E" for helping us celebrate 53 wonderful years.  We'll be back!!

n0Esv4g-ZEXzxMbD-duQ-A.text: My first visit wasn't so great because my steak was some what fatty but the dessert was awesome.  However, my first visit was when they just opened so  I tried it a second time and it was much better.  I definitely recommend this place for a business dinner or a night out with friends.

8fsI3XGqixP4BA2_dpD9GA.text: There are plenty of steak places to choose from in "Dahn Tahn Pittsburgh".  In my experience most are very good.  Eddie Merlot's is no exception.  From the moment we walked in to the moment we walked out we loved the experience.  The decor and staff were both awesome. Keep reading to find out why I went all 5 stars...  We had the bacon as an appetizer.  After smelling it go by our table to the one next to us, we didn't really have a choice.  We had to have it.  It was sweet and salty, everything you could want in candied bacon.  It was out of this world.  My main course was the Trio of Filet.  I really loved the idea of having Filet prepared 3 different ways in one sitting.  It did not disappoint.  The steak was cooked to perfection!  I don't know that I can pick a favorite.  For our side we had Eddies Potatoes.  Like everything else they were awesome...  By this point, you are tired of hearing awesome awesome awesome BUT the best part for everyone at our table was the dessert!  I have been on the hunt for a dessert place in the Burg.  Let me tell you, for as much as I loved the rest of the food, the dessert is the reason for my 5 star rating.  I would honesty be willing to go back just to have dessert and the orange Manhattan.  We literally had trouble deciding what to get because everything we saw around us looked so good.  I ended up with the peanut butter cup and my wife had the chocolate cake.  Both were melt in your mouth happiness!  I was so full but it tasted so so so very yummy that I couldn't stop eating.  Oh, the drinks were strong and full of flavor... have the orange Manhattan.  You will not be disappointed.  Did I mention the Burnt Orange Manhattan???  Finally, the location can't be much better if you like to hang out and enjoy the city after dinner.  There are plenty of public spaces to hang out these days but none better than the point at night.  I had too many Manhattans to consider driving right away.  Point State Park is a block away.  We strolled through and hung out by the water for a while.  The city really is beautiful from down there.  By the way, if you are from Pittsburgh and don't make an entire night of hanging out in the city when you head in for dinner then you are missing out.  Honestly, find a park, sit down, take in the city, and enjoy the night.  We have a beautiful city, it deserves your attention.  And have the Burnt Orange Manhattan at Eddie Merlot's... and dessert....

xEGMad2ttI2rz4AE9h3iEA.text: Good steakhouses in Pittsburgh are a dime a dozen, and Eddie Merlots is no better, no worse. Wonderful location in the heart of the golden triangle, just a few steps from market square. Also, an extremely hospitable wait staff ready to cater to any need you may have.   But when it came to the food, our experience was no better than average. The sweet and spicy shrimp had an addicting taste; however the presentation left much to be desired. It was depicted as a tipped over Chinese takeout box. Not fitting for a restaurant alleged to be a fine steak seafood establishment. For the main course, both mine and my husbands steaks were overdone, but still enjoyable. However, things were looking up by dessert. The vanilla cognac brownie was fantastic, and worth having over and over.   Overall, an experience that was no better, no worse than your average steakhouse. Not expecting to return, given other options within the city.  Here are some items that could improve the experience: - steak knives should only be placed on table when guest orders steak.  - takeout box with chopsticks on shrimp appetizer should be changed as it degrades the dish.  - staff should have clean aprons, some aprons looked well used.  - dress code should be put into effect. No one enjoys dining in an upscale environment with others wearing ball caps.  - staff should be given better lighters when providing table side service (a bright red Bic lighter found at your local gas station, isn't ideal).  - if you have signature Napkins in the restrooms and signature steak knives on the tables, why not have branded signature pens for guests to sign their checks with?

1RDPA4GT7VuWvF5D5949Tg.text: My husband and I came here for our 1yr anniversary. I must say, this place was amazing! I only have two photos of the food we ordered. believe me, there was SOOOO much more!  We had the tuna tartar which was superb! We also had the steak for two. oh my goodness was it good. Perfect about of seasoning, perfectly cooked.  The dessert was this out of the world, creme brule! oh yum!  The bread they have is out of this world!  The service was impeccable, the food quality and quantity measured perfectly.    Thank you for making our 1yr anniversary a wonderful memory!

Photo of Eddie Merlot's - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuna tartar

5qMSYyWv6tyqqvccxaWqXg.text: My husband and I were staying at the Wyndam Grand and were hungry since we never ate lunch. After checking on Yelp, I found the great reviews on this restaurant and it was 1 block away. It was 445 when we walked in and we're seated right away. That is when we knew we made the right decision....One word.....PAT! As soon as we met our waiter Pat we knew we were going to have a great experience! After browsing the drink menu we both chose some tasty drinks. I chose the Berry White Martini and it was one of best drinks....ever. I could have had a dozen of them lol. For dinner we ordered off the dinner for 2 menu for $65 it is a great deal.  I ordered the Filet and Salmon combo with the house salad.  The salad came out within a few minutes and was a good portion. The entrees were out about 15 minutes later.   The salmon literally melted in your mouth and had phenomenal flavor! The filet was good as well but I really enjoyed the salmon over the filet which is odd because I am a huge lover of filet. I would order just the salmon next time. The garlic mashed potatoes were good and so was the broccoli. Halfway through the meal Pat came over and offered to get me another drink which I was going to order the same Martini but he insisted on making me a surprise one. I'm kind of a picky drinker so I was a bit nervous but he assured me if I did not like what he brought he would bring me another Berry White Martini. When the drink showed up and I had my first taste I was immediately in love with it... just a raspberry martini but with two different vodkas in it made my taste buds dance! Throughout the meal Pat would give us tips on where to go and what to see and what to do for our one night here he was extremely pleasant and very attentive! He even chose our dessert for us bringing over Creme Brulee that we devoured in just a few minutes. While sitting at the table I was already telling my friends whenever they come to Pittsburgh they need to come and visit Pat and have a great dinner! Next time we are in the city we are definitely stopping in to visit! thank you Pat for making our Saturday night that much better!

Q7ttSp0XFphh5MacA0-KdA.text: It's been my goal to make my way through the steakhouses of Pittsburgh with each restaurant week. My husband and I go to one steakhouse each restaurant week and this time, he picked Eddie Merlot's. If he were writing this review, he would definitely give Eddie Merlot's a solid 5 star review. For me, I thought it was good, but I feel like we've had better.   In terms of ambience and service, Eddie Merlot's was great. We were seated right by a fireplace, which was perfect for the bitter cold night we stopped in.   Food-wise, we ordered candied bacon and Caesar salad for appetizers, bone-in filets and Eddie's potatoes for entrees, and chocolate cake and chocolate pots de creme for dessert. The candied bacon was phenomenal and the steak was prepared and seasoned perfectly. However, the potatoes were disappointing. Flavoring of the potatoes was on point, but they were undercooked. I just wasn't expecting crunchy cheesy potatoes. Desserts were okay and didn't blow me away. I do want to give a mention to the bread, though. It had a crunchy, garlicky exterior and was perfectly warm and pillowy on the inside.   Overall, I'd probably come back, but I'd skip the potatoes and maybe stop somewhere else for dessert.

NUstqFRIXxthpFMFwXLjOg.text: I work right by Eddie Merlot's and I've always wanted an excuse to try it out. They were offering a summer special menu so it seemed like the perfect excuse to go.  The summer special menu was fairly limited so I went with the salmon option. I was unfortunately disappointed. It didn't have much flavor to it. It was very bland and could have used something extra. Perhaps a more flavorful sauce or some more spice.   Everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy their meal however. Perhaps I just ordered the wrong dish. While I'm certainly not in a rush to try it again, I think I would like to try out their regular menu at some point. Perhaps for a special occasion.

CAcsAysoxn54-Ax2-U2wSw.text: I work in 4 Gateway and have lunch here frequently. The lunch is pretty affordable and our server, Pat, is always fantastic. He makes us feel like valued guests every time and we make sure to ask for him by name!

Fq_eoZfzS7xIrto9rtVGrg.text: Been here twice. Once for lunch and once for dinner.  It's honestly no different from any other higher-end chain steakhouses.  The food was good and as good as any other restaurant in the same category.  For dinner I had filet mignon and a baked potato. Both cooked appropriately.  For lunch I had Cajun marinated steak salad and the meat was cooked according to my request.

_nGssL4hxJ9hntfz17ATuw.text: Fantastic spot in the heart of town to get dinner. Came here on New Years Eve with my love to celebrate. We sat at the bar for dinner since we aren't big on reservations- so glad we did! The Bartender was exceptionally friendly and made our night that much more fun with just being kind and attentive. We had Filet, lobster tails, scallops, some kind of wonderful cheesy potato & broccoli for dinner. Not to forget we started with oysters which were also excellent!  Dessert may have been the best part of the meal.. on their holiday menu there was a chocolate sampler which had every chocolate dessert in the house one one plate. I would come here just for that alone! It was a "wow" dining experience!  We stayed here for quite a while knowing that it would be hard getting in anywhere else for New Years.. well this was not a mistake, because by the time we left there was a band playing right in the heart of town a few steps away from this restaurant, and by Midnight there were fireworks that could be seen to all that were dining here. What a treat!

ZVLq_twaRzK3JXBQ8mqfVw.text: One of the best steaks I have ever had.  My wife and I ordered the top sirloin for 2, medium, and it was amazing.  Highly recommend with glass of Malbec.

bScW7_OypgCCF4nFTa7dcg.text: You know it's Restaurant Week in Pittsburgh when I'm writing an Eddie Merlot's review.   My husband and I took advantage of the $35 menu and had a wonderful experience. I ordered the 7 oz. filet and it was perfectly cooked. My husband went with the salmon and absolutely loved it. I ordered a baked potato on the side (which cost extra), but it was worth it. The potato was huge and we were able to split it down the middle. It came with sour cream, butter, bacon, and chives on the side (no upcharge for any of it).   We both went with the chocolate cake for dessert. As a chocoholic, I can  say with confidence that it was delightful. Even my husband, who isn't typically a dessert man, said that it was amazing cake.   Our server was attentive and helpful. Our glasses were never empty and we weren't sitting around waiting for the check.   Overall, we had a great experience and were happy to note that even though the prices were significantly discounted, the service and quality of food were not.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie Merlot's - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate Cake - yum!
Photo of Eddie Merlot's - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 7 oz Filet with half of the baked potato serving. Delicious.

d8XxhRdCEsyrDUezaGJRdQ.text: I visited Eddie Merlot's with my family for a post graduation dinner. We had a reservation and they seated us right away. The decor of this restaurant is honestly really beautiful and very fancy. I enjoyed it a lot. We decided to start our meal by splitting some calamari. Unfortunately, the calamari was very airy and there was not a lot of meat. We expressed this to our waiter and he willingly took it off of our bill which we appreciated. As for meals, I ordered the sea bass and then our table split the lobster mac and cheese for the side. The sea bass was fresh and delicious. It came with a very refreshing sauce that I thought complimented the fish as well as the vegetables it came with. I would recommend this dish to any seafood lover! As for the lobster mac and cheese, we really enjoyed it but we actually had a manager approach our table and tell us that he thought it was lacking an adequate amount of lobster. He said he was taking it off the bill as well. We were very surprised by that and appreciated that he cared so much. Additionally, they knew there was a graduate our table and even brought out a free dessert to celebrate! It was a great and unexpected surprise.   The only reason I am rating it four stars is because of the "skimpy-ness" of those two dishes. Other than that, I enjoyed my visit.

BLoL7a3RITDEmf1GSaa54A.text: I really enjoyed this place .  This is a great option of you are looking for a higher end dinner downtown.  We had the artichoke dip as an app and it was really good, especially the pita bread that came with it. For dinner, I had the filet with the shrimp and the mashed potatoes. I really enjoyed this although  my husbands entree came with seasoned shrimp and I will say his was better since it was so flavorful!   The salad the dinner came with was also really good. They make all there dressings in house, I would definitely order again.  We absolutely loved the hot bread before dinner too. Just a tip,  sit in the lounge before dinner during their happy hour specials! I believe it was $3 off wine and cocktails .  Our waiter was very helpful. We advised we were heading to a show at Heinz hall at 7, and he did a really good job moving us along so we were able to make it on time. He even told us next time to park there since they do validate parking.  Overall, I really would enjoy a trip back to Eddie Merlot's.

oJGX0JDvrfejBwtpW0e3Fw.text: Oh. My. God. I am so SO overly impressed with my experience at Eddie Merlot's.  We came on a Monday night and had reservations for 5:30. We had made these reservations the day of so I'm surprised we got in. Upon entering, we were greeted by a friendly smile from the host. They must have taken note that it was our anniversary so everyone who saw us along the way to our table made sure to wish us a happy anniversary. I thought this gesture was so sweet and kind! When arriving at our table, the gentleman kindly pulled my chair out for me to sit. He was sure to let us know that our server will be over shortly and quickly went over the menu with us. Neither my boyfriend or I had been here before so we didn't know where to start! I don't eat meat, so I was on the lookout for any vegetarian or vegan options. They actually had a ton to chose from! I was shocked because this place is know for their steaks and meats.   When our server, Ziad came over, he introduced himself and asked if we had any further questions regarding the menu. He took my drink order and promptly came back with my glass of Merlot. It was fantastic! I'm usually not a dry wine gal, but this wine was great. And I love that they even give you an extra serving of it when they pour it.   Now time for the food. My boyfriend and I hardly take super fancy dinner dates, so we decided to make this one count. We started off with the Spinach and artichoke dip. It came out about 15 minutes later and oh my god it was to die for. It was served with warm pita chips that were lightly salted with sea salt and it was the perfect touch. The dip itself was outstanding and actually came out at the perfect temperature. It looked like it was going to be too hot, but once you bit into the cheesy artichoke hearts, it was all perfect.  Next was time for the main course. My boyfriend took advantage of the Restaurant Week special they were running and got some meat-based dishes. I didn't try any of his food but he said they were the best he's ever had. I chose the Vegetarian Bucatini. And I'm SO glad I did. We also ordered a side of Eddie's potatoes & a side of Mac n Cheese (go big or go home right?)   The Bucatini. Wow. I can't even begin to describe the flavor that erupted in my mouth within that first bite. A perfectly portioned size pasta dish with a butternut squash puree served with garden fresh veggies. The noodles were cooked to the perfect texture and was accompanied by the right amount of puree. The vegetables (broccoli, zucchini, and mushrooms) were all so tender and delicious. The dish, as a whole, was the best dish I have EVER eaten in my life.   Can't forget about the potatoes & mac n cheese. The Mac n Cheese was subpar. The crumbled bread crumbs gave it a nice texture but there wasn't anything super distinct about the flavor. Eddies potatoes though were so delicious. They were spiced so delicately and packed a flavorful punch of jalapeno cheddar. I would definitely get the photos it's again!   We finished the meal with a slice of carrot cake. I had never tried carrot cake before so I didn't know what to expect. And let me just tell you, this cake blew my mind. Between the carrot, the pineapple, and the icing, it was just so flavorful and comforting. The perfect end to the most amazing meal I've ever had.   All in all, I would give Eddie Merlot's a 6/5 if I could. The whole experience was so amazing and I can't WAIT for my next trip here. Between the service, the attention to detail, and the food, Eddie Merlot's is now my favorite place to dine.

RcOYT4MI4Npoacd2zCDB9w.text: Some may say that Eddie's is a little above average as steakhouses goes, but what sets Eddie Merlot's apart from other steakhouses is the superior level of service that the staff provides.  One server that stands out among the rest is Pat.  Pat is exceptional.  He makes us feel very welcomed, he's attentive and his timing on whether to check on us or give is time is amazing. Great food, atmosphere and service.

-Hg_ToWt7_O-Lmupb2Iezw.text: We went there during the restaurant festival. So huge discount. Amazing environment and service, but i cannot say the same about the food. The lobster bisque is too salty. The steak and salmon are not juicy at all. The desert are just like other desert you can get from a two-dollars restaurant. I don't know if the festival menu is different, but we were a little disappointed.

Photo of Eddie Merlot's - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. steak

CKNWVi6pZKkywI5KZP8ncw.text: Elegant atmosphere and overall an enjoyable evening out with family, but lacking anything to earn more stars. Maybe I was set up for disappointment because of the hype or because the prices imply something special. The food was good, but nothing memorable. Once again, I found myself watching others eat, because after careful iteration of my need for a gluten-free meal and reassurance from our waiter, my meal arrived with bread covering half the plate. IMHO, at a restaurant of this caliber, this calls for management to offer an apology. At least offer a small salad while I wait for my meal to be remade.

b7Nt8qaafW4wUjFS5gChog.text: 5 stars for the atmosphere and experience, 4 stars for the food.   We started the evening at 5:30 with drinks and appetizers at the bar. The drinks were good and had small twist on them. Meaning, they had spiced cherry moscow mule, instead of just plain mules. Prices ranged from $9-16.   For dinner, our waiters name was Gordon. He did a great job entertaining us and he enhanced the experience by having good conversations. We didn't leave until 11 PM.   I had the medium rare 7oz BMS 9+. With Brussels sprouts, asparagus, creamy corn, and french fries. The steak didn't meet my expectations, it didn't hold its structure in the middle and was somewhat spongy, medium rare shouldn't do this, the flavor was good, but not worth $100. The brussel sprouts and asparagus were not over seasoned or cooked and retained some of their natural flavor and healthiness, which was a relief.   For dessert we had the carrot cake, peanut butter cake, and banana foster. All were very good. The banana foster is cooked table side, but I think the presentation was underwhelming and didn't constitute preparing table side.   Overall this is a great place for food, great conversation, and atmosphere.

Photo of Eddie Merlot's - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carrot cake

Dn3bsDti_ch0e312JFhTsg.text: Wow truly impressed with my second visit at Eddie Merlot's! Let's be honest here, this is a typical steak/seafood house. The food is terrific although unexciting. Again though typical. However what makes me give 5 stars is the service. Rheanna was one of the best servers I've ever had. She knew when to make her presence known, and when to let me and my best friend enjoying restaurant week to ourselves. I was even more blown away when she made it a point to quickly gather our desserts to go and get our check taken care of promptly, as we were in a rush. The thing that impressed me the most was that she respected two 20 something year olds who were just casually trying to enjoy a nice evening out, always checking in on us and being super friendly the whole time. I've been here once before and was super impressed the first time with my server. I'm pleased to learn the service really lives up to its name. Rheanna and her other service members were awesome. I'll absolutely be back to enjoy!

S0bxwGMJ6vjCMaEnOMpm8Q.text: I have never been so disappointed in a steakhouse as I was at Eddie Merlot's. The waitress was dismissive and did not pay much attention to us. We weren't even given bread. At the end of our meal she handed us the checks and didn't even ask if we wanted dessert. Then once we were done w dessert, she was no where to be found and we waited about 15 minutes before she showed back up. The manager never even stopped by our table to see how we were doing but he stopped at other tables. We ordered two appetizers, a bottle of wine, wagyu steaks (which were not worth it) and two desserts. The quality of the food was not worth it and the service was appalling. To say that I would never go back or recommend this place would be an understatement. I would 100% recommend that you go to Eddie V's or Morton's if you want a real meal with real service.

E_bbqVT4lKrzpKvLpvrc5g.text: Excellent!!!  Worth every dime!  Great service and amazing food!!  Can't wait to go back.

3cPNXmSsmAI2JwoqqbTAyg.text: Hands down! One of our most memorable dining experiences in Pittsburgh! We came here to celebrate a family event. Our waiter was so friendly and attentive. The dining tables have just enough space between them so it gives a great dining-out vibe while at the same time does not prevent having intimate conversations within one table. I loved that! I feel like this is an important aspect which a lot of restaurants are missing.  We ordered four different salads and all were great. For our entree we ordered beef steaks (different cuts) and the buffalo. All were juicy and tasty (we ordered medium rare and they came out just right). For desserts we had the chocolate and carrot cake. I felt the carrot cake was a little too sweet though. Also, we wanted to get espresso, but they said the machine is broken which I find a lame excuse for a restaurant like this (cannot they just buy one for reserve? I am sure Eddie Merlot can afford this) . But it did not matter that night since we had a great experience dining here, both food and service wise.

frQsx-ZUK9M_RQUkDl0Gog.text: Eddie Merlot's is our "go to" restaurant!  We always enjoy our visits and have never been disappointed!  We use the word "visit" because that's exactly what it feels like ... going to a friend's beautiful home for a lovely evening of delicious food and great wine, along with enjoyable conversations with their excellent staff.  It's a good location for any of the theater venues in Downtown Pittsburgh.  The underground parking garage is very convenient and they have validated free parking after 5:00pm.  Their Platinum Club is well worth joining!

mIklcXaKLMloZhDfeYtRQw.text: Great palace for a nice steak meal. Equally nice was the wait staff. I really liked the Merlot salad and the ny strip! My husband said the peanut butter cup was one of the best desserts he's ever had.

_Qv5tZSwDw4D7_Oz_YKdfw.text: Great food and great service. Definitely at the top of the list of Pittsburgh Steak Houses.

mM4poSphSYBpHcMXebvl6Q.text: From the beginning until the end of our meal the service was outstanding. The waiter was very helpful & vetted in finding things we liked as well as helping us pair amazing drinks with our even more amazing steaks. One of the best steak I've had across the country.

eYRUeuH3OAJQvMVJQn21cg.text: I loved there lobster Mac n cheese by far my favorite the steak was good too not the best tho kinda plain and dry for the price I just expected more

u--BYwBLy8jFsI14W9sxBA.text: Went here with my boyfriend and his family for his birthday celebration. This is the best steak I've had. I got the ribeye oscar style (so fricken good), we all shared brussel sprouts, eddies potatoes, and mac and cheese. The potatoes were okay, not bad just a little bland. The brussel sprouts were amazing however, and the mac and cheese was also to die for. For dessert I had the bananas foster and WOW was it good. Pricey for sure, but well worth it if you are looking for a nice meal. Definitely one of my new favorites.

w8MkIvinghw246192KErXQ.text: I couldn't have been more pleased. Went for their Mothers Day Buffet and the selection was out of this world. We could choose from the usual, eggs, bacon, made to order omelets to filet, cut to our liking. I am a meatloaf lover and their's was the best I ever tasted. Desserts filled almost the entire length of the bar. There isn't a bad word to say about the establishment and the decor is just as fabulous. The service was excellent, the entire staff was pleasant and accommodating. I would highly recommend and plan to return in the near future.

jnrbhIy3oIp6jp1pYq1QqA.text: This place never loses its charm on me. The service is amazing, the food is out of this world, and the atmosphere is very comfortable. If you want to really spend alot of money on quality food. This place is for you.

B1d-t68RNdk17yHgBCDVmQ.text: My husband and I ate dinner at Eddie Merlot's for Valentine's Day. The aha tartare was delicious, the lobster bisque had some meat, the short ribs were tender, the sea scallops were good, the crab cakes had too much bread in them and not enough meat, the filet mignons were cooked to our liking, and the asparagus was cooked and seasoned well. The waiter was nice. When our entrees were brought out, we were asked if we needed anything else. We asked for salt and pepper. 15 minutes later, we still did not have our salt and pepper, so we had to ask a second time.

fBaxd2wBBIgQO30Bf3njmg.text: Prior to dining here, I had read some of the reviews online.  I would have to echo the sentiments that were expressed.  The service was outstanding.  John, our waiter, was attentive and kind.  The room is beautiful and comfortable.  The lobster bisque was superb.  The issue was the preparing of the steaks.  This seems to be a common complaint on here about Eddie Merlot's.  Three people ordered steaks medium-well.  All three came medium-rare and were sent back.  They offered to butterfly them to which we all agreed.  They came back out without being butterflied and warmer, but not any more done.  Two things: I don't understand what is so difficult about cooking a steak to the desired temperature and secondly, if this sentiment has been expressed repeatedly on Yelp, why isn't Eddie Merlot's addressing it?  For the price, and make no mistake about it, this is one of the most expensive restaurants in the city, I was disappointed.

7vuKhWfiAgOFeH9S6JjBnw.text: Our party of four dined here last night after spotting it on an earlier visit to Pittsburgh. Delicious! Our dinner selections-Caesar salad, wedge salad, and French onion soup were quick and very tasty! The bread for the table was hot and yummy. Dinner was a ribeye, mixed grill, filet and the trio of medallions. No one was disappointed-everything was cooked spot on. Even with a dining room that filled and a couple special event parties arriving during our dinner, we were FULL and out in time for the football game. Thanks for an awesome experience!

QQ2qotc3Bu93XAWocbtxaQ.text: Absolutely perfect. This is the same location as the old Palomino, and I loved that place, so I was a bit skeptical... Was staying across the street so we walked over on a Friday night right when they opened. Greeted by 2 very friendly gentlemen and taken to our table, a nice big round booth. I think we had the best waiter ever... His name was Don. Super attitude, funny, attentive and a great voice!!! Food was to die for. Best oysters I've ever tasted (clean-no grit). I had the bison filet, delish. Husband had NY strip, perfectly cooked. We had several apps including the steak tartar... This was also wonderful. The wine was good. The cocktails were good. We made the mistake of ordering carrot cake that could have fed 6 people!!! We ended up giving 3/4 to friends of ours who were having dinner at the next table. Although the name of this place is not as widely known as Cap Grille, Mortons or Ruth's, it far surpasses all of them in my opinion!

7r1-Z9zqJZ6QVUfUeF5kDg.text: Enjoyed a birthday lunch here with my girlfriend.  The restaurant itself was very clean with a classy feel. We enjoyed our crab wonton and crab cake appetizers. Next,  we got our entrees. My 14oz NY strip was good but not great. I wouldn't put it before Hyde Park,  capital grille or Ruth chris's.  On the other hand,  my girlfriend's spare rib meat loaf was amazing. The spare rib was in the center and was very tender. They piled mashed potatoes as high as the meat loaf to make it level for the friend onions. Keep in mind this was for lunch and the portion was enormous.  We will be back for lunch and one if not both of us will be getting the spare rib meat loaf. I almost forgot,  my girlfriend wanted to surprise me so she went to talk to the hostess and asked to have a desert brought to me. My girlfriend asked for something  red velvet (my favorite)  and sure enough they brought out a red velvet cupcake with butter cream icing. Oh and a cold shot of milk. It was complimentary as well! We enjoyed our time at Eddie Merlot's!

ItFf6ANKJruOEISq0q6d9A.text: Stopped here when other restaurants were full. Had a super Ceaser salad (huge) with anchovies, and trout amandine with haricots verts for only $30!  Can't beat that!

qfDh2jrvG3sOPwaBJqHp3g.text: Nice location and nice view of outside. Has an open feel to it. Though it was busy on a week night, didn't feel crowded. Excellent service ! From the lady at the reception to servers. Food was good too. Caesar salad was ok. Salmon was made to perfection. Good choice of desert (creme br, carrot cake).  They validate your parking if you park in the gateway garage.   I would say among the top steak houses in downtown. 4 stars overall. Gave 5 for the service on top!

GUDJskixZW6ckivRjzcK5A.text: Mediocre service on a not so busy night.  Three bartenders should be able to handle 14 bar patrons.

7rESsc3nyOx4R4MtL2ohtg.text: Incredible food and service. HIGHLY recommend for a special evening. Best views of all the steak houses in Pittsburgh. Staff very accommodating. The curved booths are nice for a romantic dinner.

twFf0ZuH_n_lstXlPtDkYA.text: Went to lunch there with some colleagues.  Decor is quite splendid--very airy and not gaudy.  Noise level is excellent so you can carry on a conversation without echoes or fighting house music. The menu is not overly ambitious and had something for everyone, including some staples like French onion soup, lobster bisque, and creme brulee.  The short rib meatloaf, Black & Blue flatbread, and BBQ shrimp (huge) were all excellent.  My Crab Louie was just OK.  Everyone enjoyed the peanut butter cup with the only complaint being that they couldn't finish it! Definitely recommended

W61FHt5Cm43rFXNeuO1aug.text: We had a company Christmas Party there.    Each meal was prepared with attention to details.   Filet was tender and cooked perfectly.  Salmon was juicy and has a nice char.  Pork chop with peaches are the envy of other dinners.  Creamed spinach converted non-spinach eater.  Carrot Cake was fresh and not too sweet.  I did not have the creme brulee but I saw scraping from other diners.  Emily was the head waitstaff of our party... service was efficient and on point.   She was friendly and attentive.   Kim was the banquet manager and she came to our party several times to make sure the event is going smooth.  Tom Mielo the manager is hospitable, professional and very hard working.  We were pampered at Eddie Merlot.  Aside from the great food ... the service was outstanding.   What a staff, what great employee culture !!!

3fCKtFrBuPRfTalPegqcXA.text: My son and I had a delightful meal sitting at the bar with Tiffany.  Great drinks, great food, great banter, great atmosphere and we met some delightful people too. We will return

744Gl1yJvHQ7lZe__CZ0Mg.text: My family and I stopped in for lunch and had a great time! We had a reservation and were seated immediately at a nice, large round table.  It was my first time dining here and I thoroughly enjoyed my overall experience. The environment is bright, open, and well decorated. The service was excellent and very accommodating.   We started off by sharing the shrimp flatbread, which our server recommended and it was quite tasty! I also ordered a cup of the lobster bisque, which was amazing, full of flavor and actually had substantial lobster meat. Next, I opted out of ordering the burger that caught my eye, as the soup was more filling than I expected, and went on a lighter route with the Southwest Chicken Caesar salad. The salad was okay, but nothing spectacular.  The ingredients were fresh, but were completely drowning in the dressing.  Next time, I will be sure to order it on the side- or go with the burger instead.  It was a bit pricey for lunch, especially for a sub par salad, but I am looking forward to give it another try!

OnxUEGkpERssEguW4YdWyw.text: I'd been wanting to check out Eddie Merlot's, so when Pittsburgh restaurant week came around, I grabbed the opportunity!  In case you haven't checked out Pittsburgh Restaurant week in the past (and if you haven't, you must next time!), you usually get a smaller menu to choose.  You get an appetizer, entree, and dessert for a set price. The restaurant week menu was pretty fair I thought, and the right price!, $35 for 3 courses compared to around $40 for just the steak.  Yep, it's an a la carte place, so be prepared.  My first course was absolutely delicious.  I chose the Caesar salad and it was a VERY generous portion.  The fresh ground pepper really took it over the edge.  They also delivered out a warm mini round loaf of bread for us to enjoy, which was quite tasty.    For my entree, I chose the steak diane option.  Now I know what steak diane is and all, but for a fancy restaurant I thought the presentation was really lacking.  It looked like they had opened a can of wet dog food and poured it over mashed potatoes.  Luckily it tasted WAYYY better than it looked!  The steak was tender, melt in your mouth, with a wonderful gravy enhancing the steak's own flavor.  The mashed potatoes were thick, creamy, with just the right amount of chunks.  It would have been nice to have a vegetable on the plate as well, but alas, it was a restaurant week special.  If it wasn't ridiculously expensive, I'd love to come back and have a True steak.  For dessert, I had the carrot cake which was an overall small portion, but was just perfect after all the food I had already consumed.  More sweet than spicy carrot cake with a just right cream cheese frosting.  Loved the pineapple in the cake that added that extra sweetness and acidity!  The service was amazing.  Definitely a wine place, not a beer place.  Nothing is on tap and the only problem with the service was that the waitress did not seem to be very familiar with the beer list.  With craft brews becoming more and more popular, I would expect even a steakhouse to have a few that the staff can assist you in picking from.  Overall, it was a good, but not amazing, restaurant week menu and experience.  Would I go again?  Certainly not for full price, and most likely not for restaurant week.  I would hope that next time restaurant week rolls around their menu would be more similar to other steakhouses in Pittsburgh with more options.

aUON185HnDPJn_rvVeHstQ.text: Got the 16oz bone in Filet cooked a perfectly medium rare.  Hard to say what is the best Steak I've ever had at this point as I've had so many and this one ranks right up there with them.  The sweet potatoes were excellent and the side salad was perfect as well.  Girlfriend got the 7oz Filet and it was cooked perfect as well.  We split the crab cake that we added for $10.  That might be the only only thing I could pick on as it was in the really small side.  But it tasted really good.  We also split the creme brulee which was also really good.  Service was top notch.  Can't wait to go back.

bEH3GzDVbHmjsbgqyMruDg.text: One of my go to spots for business lunch or dinner!  Excellent staff and some of the best food in the city.  You can't go wrong with their lobster bisque and the steaks???  Forget about it!  If you haven't yet been, you should do something about that.  If you have, well you already know.

IRbTMjzaX4Fk0B3d-tev1Q.text: Was in town for work and wandered into this place off of the street. Phenomenal and friendly service, matched only by their food. I highly recommend the salmon, and have never had more delicious garlic mashed potatoes. The atmosphere was also a nice blend of upscale yet laid back.

e4d3zeXS8wCE5zNj2OcvcQ.text: Hands down the best steakhouse I have ever been too nationwide! The staff and food are just phenomenal! Try the lobster mac and cheese and the carrot cake!  Also, Love the iPad menus!

6YlZsv-4Wy7H9NpQdxFEzg.text: Wow wow wow! Just finished eating the BEST meal of our first trip to Pittsburgh. The staff was fabulous from the time we checked in with the hosts to our waiter Tera with the great helpers. The oysters were so fresh and delicious. We asked for horseradish for the cocktail sauce. It was fresh and trimmed in the back. I had never had it in this preparation and it made the sauce. My husband inhaled the pork chops and I had the steak. The wedge salad was the best we've ever had. The spinach salad was great. Cannot say enough good things. We were in town for the US Open so had not come prepared for a dressy night. Even though he was in shorts and flip flops as was I, they made us feel comfortable and welcome. Please give this one a try.

_J5uPOBOJgT9ytLuy-5qLg.text: Huge menu and the people were SOOO nice but the food was just so-so.  Steaks were ok, not great and lobster kind of mushy.  Tuna tartare appetizer was the only stand out for me.   Large seafood selection for a steak place, which is why we picked it, but not worth a return trip.

Lran9scNkcaRsYPOXVZP0Q.text: Very nice place, 1st time there and we weren't disappointed... Food was great and so was the staff..

t967ZSfD50YVCjDpoUz7FQ.text: I stopped by here a couple of Fridays ago with my wife for dinner.  Having been in this place during its two previous restaurants, I was eager to see what changes, if any they had made.  I was not to be disappointed as Eddie Merlots had left the floor plan of the restaurant the same but they really did a good job on updating the decor of the place.  This was especially True in the chandelliers as well as the mosaics that were hanging along the walls.  For dinner my wife and I decided to start out the evening with the sesame calamari appetizer while she also chose to order the lobster bisque soup.  Thankfullly my wife was kind enough to save me one of the larger pieces of lobster in her bisque as well as some broth from it so that I could try it.  I have to admit that it was pretty good with the lobster being cooked perfectly and the bisque being seasoned nicely.  I also really enjoyed our calamari which came with three different sauces: a garlic/ginger soy sauce, ahot mustard sauce and a wasabi sauce.  The calamari was also cooked perfectly as the outside breading had a nice crunch while the inside was soft and chewy and not rubbery at all.  For my dinner entree I had a hard time deciding between the 16 oz. bourbon-marinated ribeye steak and the bison filet mignon.  My choice ultimately ended up being the bourbon-marinated filet which I made after consulting with our server.  My wife ended up going with the steak frites for her entree and we decided to split a side order of the macaroni and cheese.  The bourbon marinated steak ended up being quite large, tender and very good.  You could really taste the bourbon in and it gave the steak a subtle sweetness while at the same time giving it a bit of a bite which I had never had in a steak before.  The macaroni and cheese also ended up being good although it didn't have anything special that stood out to me.  After all of that food we still somehow had a little room for dessert and so we ended up ordering the carrot cake.  The piece that they gave us was absolutley humongus and could have easily been shared by a table of 4.  I ended up enjoying it as it tasted how I thought a carrot cake should.  With the dessert finished and the bill paid we ended up getting our parking validated at the hostess station and left the restaurant quite full but also a bit lighter in the wallet.  The bottom line for me is that I would head here again in the future.  The service that we received here was quite good and the food was as well.

0uINRzg0ilMzKqjawZOvpg.text: Perfect spot for a romantic dinner. Ordered the Bison Ribeye, and it was amazing. Cooked perfectly, with cream spinach and sweet potato casserole it was more good than I needed to eat...but I finished every bite. Wife had Alaskan Salmon, she said it was wonderful as well and then we split a peanut butter cup dessert that had the consistency of cheesecake but all the peanut butter flavor of a Reese's. Valentines Day dinner was perfect, wait staff was very professional and attentive.

OlQpUW7lxot1mZDmUCLToA.text: Couldnt have asked for a better experience. Cindy, our server, and manager Tom took care of us and made the night very special. Everything was great, service and food. Thanks again for everything- we will be back.

K9Tzb_b-5w15o423RLZ-gQ.text: Disappointing. After a great experience  during restaurant week ,my husband and I came back  for our anniversary. Our service  was slow, the waiter was no help in recommending anything on the menu, just said "everything is good and it is my favorite menu." When we finally got the chance to place our order, the table beside us spilled a drink so he stopped taking our order when we were in mid-sentence  to clean it up. Instead of flagging someone else he continued to help the other table including going to get more napkins and new beverages for the group. This is after we had been waiting over 25 minutes with no bread or drinks besides water.  We decided to split the wagyu ribeye  for two along with mashed potatoes and Brussel sprouts. While the steak was good, we certainly weren't blown away. The sides were really basic and my husband even commented that the mashed potatoes I make at home were more flavorful than the ones they served us!   We were expecting a little bit of extra fanfare since we made it known that we were celebrating  a special occasion but unfortunately our experience was sub par.

-Cbv_lGI83e6t_0KvTNo2Q.text: Wow....we couldn't have asked for a better waitress! Shauna was phenomenal! She was down-to-earth, personable, and had great customer service. Not to mention the steaks were so great!!!! Tom was unbelievably friendly and made us feel right at home. I would recommend this place to every single person that comes to Pittsburgh.  We revisit every year!

yQN3j4LfezOMcnCmed-F0w.text: I was here with a group of people for my sister's birthday. We all had differing opinions of the restaurant, but personally, I was satisfied overall.  I'm not a huge fan of steak, so I never like it when I am invited to these types of restaurants. You know the places where everything on the menu is "aged to perfection," ala carte, costs $60, and is the size of a golf ball. That being said, Eddie Merlot's did have some reasonably priced menu options to choose from in addition to the steak.  I had the barbecue braised short ribs with garlic mashed potatoes and a caesar salad. The meat was prepared perfectly! It was fork tender and the sauce was delicious. I enjoyed every bite.   The down side was that the overall service was very slow for the number of people in the restaurant at the time.   As a side note that I did not include when giving my rating, everything that my party ordered looked great, but some of the entree portions were unreasonably small.

Cg5tvgDMK8zzb5UyEztZCA.text: Thanks josh for fantastic service and meeting Our groups dietary needs! Enjoyed the seabass I had tonight and really liked the Brussel sprouts as well. The outdoor patio was great and the food came out fresh and looking great. I'll definitely be back, especially after a great walk at point state park!

P8HhFJAHjzRh5jF3IP7BvQ.text: I attended a luncheon here and the food was spectacular. I had filet mignon and cheesecake. Both of these were so delicious! I will likely dine here again, but it will be for a business lunch and not a dinner with my family.

LqrjEvj2Koqlq5Wb_m_bFw.text: My girlfriend suggested this place for our pre theater meal. Fantastic Service & Fantastic Food! We sat at the bar and had a glass of wine before our meal the bartenders were Super nice and friendly. Off to a good start. Our waiter was very knowledgable and gave us the rundown of the specials and his recommendations. We started of with the filet pot stickers. The size was perfect and they were really flavorful. So picking the appetizer was easy but now comes the hard part deciding on an entree. So we decided on the Louisiana sampler which came with a 7oz filet andouille sausage mashed potatoes and choice of soup and salad . Since they do not offer a side salad the waiter was kind enough to have the kitchen split the wedge salad for us. My friend ordered a side of Brussels sprouts and I was agonizing between the truffle parmesan fries or the lobster mashed potatoes . Now for anyone who follows my reviews has to know I haven't met a fry I didn't like lol. Soooooo I went with the fries. I'm definitely gonna try those mashed potatoes next time. My filet was cooked perfectly it sliced like butta! The fries we're seasoned to perfection. Yes I know we ordered a mound of food needless to say we had tons of leftovers. The side dishes at the place are meant to be shared. So we're both stuffed and our waiter offered us the dessert menu I readily replied Bring It!! Lol they have tons of treats to pick from and I decided on the peanut butter pie. I took one bite and was like YASSSSS !!!! The peanut butter filling was silky smooth not overly sweet. Just the right amount of crust and chocolate. So needless to say this place is worth every penny!
